Author: NotNite
Name: cl_showpos
Description: Shows your exact position, rotation, and velocity on screen. Based off of the cl_showpos command from the Source Engine.

Author: goat
Name: Wotsit
Description:
Adds a convenient quick search akin to Spotlight that lets you open game windows, teleport, find wiki articles, and more.
Press Control + T to open the search window. This can be changed by searching for "Wotsit Settings".
Punchline: Find anything, go anywhere, in style.

Author: goat
Name: Discord Rich Presence
Description: This plugin allows you to show your zone, job, level, name, and world in your Discord status.
Punchline: Show your zone, job, level, name, and world in your Discord status
Changelog:
* Added party grouping support, will show people you group with on Discord if they also use the plugin
* Now shows AFK status by default, can be disabled
* Now shows queue position if Waitingway is installed

Author: perchbird
Name: Damage Info
Description: Configurable options for in-game fly text color based on damage type, with additional settings for damage source and fly text decluttering options.
Punchline: Modifies in-game fly-text for more (or less) damage information.

Author: Infi
Name: Better Playtime
Description:
Provides expanded functionality to seamlessly track total playtime.
Requires only using /playtime once on each character (again to refresh the time),

- Supports multiple characters,
- Customisable output formats such as hours or minutes
Punchline: Ever wanted detailed information on your playtime all the way down to the second?

Author: Kaz Wolfe
Name: XIVDeck Game Plugin
Description:
This plugin allows players to place virtually any hotbar-able action onto a Stream Deck, including hotbar slots themselves. Actions are called directly, meaning no keybinds or awkward settings are necessary.

Note that the XIVDeck Stream Deck plugin must also be installed for this plugin to be useful. You can download the Stream Deck plugin from the linked GitHub repository, under the "Releases" section.

Please report all problems to KazWolfe#2896 in the Dalamud Support server or by opening an Issue on GitHub.
Punchline: Integrate your Stream Deck with Final Fantasy XIV!
